parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate or party. It promotes an open training session for a local football team, Gloria Ultra.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True.  The post is a paid Facebook advertisement targeting a wide geographical area within Romania (Botoșani County and surrounding areas), aiming to reach a large audience interested in local sports.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote a public event, a football team's open training session. There is no discernible intention to influence the outcome of any election.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post could be considered a form of local news or community announcement, similar to what a local news outlet might publish. It informs the public about a local event.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express personal opinions.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>457140753719233</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a local sports event, an open training session for the Gloria Ultra football team.  The content is entirely unrelated to the parliamentary elections. The targeting is geographically focused, but this does not constitute electoral propaganda. The post does not mention any political candidates, parties, or advocate for any particular voting outcome.  The paid nature of the post does not automatically make it electoral propaganda; the content itself must be analyzed. In this case, the content is purely informational and promotional, concerning a local sports event.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Vocea - Dorohoi</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
